014package org.jdbi.v3.core.spi;
015
016import java.sql.Connection;
017import java.sql.SQLException;
018
019import org.jdbi.v3.core.Handle;
020import org.jdbi.v3.core.Jdbi;
021
022/**
023 * A plugin is given an opportunity to customize instances of various {@code Jdbi}
024 * types before they are returned from their factories.
025 */
026public interface JdbiPlugin {
027    /**
028     * Configure customizations global to any object managed by this Jdbi.
029     * This method is invoked immediately when the plugin is installed.
030     * @param jdbi the jdbi to customize
031     * @throws SQLException something went wrong with the database
032     */
033    default void customizeJdbi(Jdbi jdbi) throws SQLException {}
034
035    /**
036     * Configure customizations for a new Handle instance.
037     * @param handle the handle just created
038     * @return the transformed handle
039     * @throws SQLException something went wrong with the database
040     */
041    default Handle customizeHandle(Handle handle) throws SQLException {
042        return handle;
043    }
044
045    /**
046     * Configure customizations for a newly acquired Connection.
047     * @param conn the connection Jdbi acquired
048     * @return the transformed connection to use
049     * @throws SQLException something went wrong with the database
050     */
051    default Connection customizeConnection(Connection conn) throws SQLException {
052        return conn;
053    }
054
055    /**
056     * Abstract base class for single-install JdbiPlugins.
057     */
058    @SuppressWarnings("EqualsGetClass")
059    abstract class Singleton implements JdbiPlugin {
060        @Override
061        public boolean equals(Object obj) {
062            return obj != null && getClass().equals(obj.getClass());
063        }
064
065        @Override
066        public int hashCode() {
067            return getClass().hashCode();
068        }
069    }
070}
